Instructor: Anobha Gurung  Amazing! She was always available and engaged with students' discussion and projects.

narratives.question_text: What were the strengths and weaknesses of your teaching assistant
comments: Instructor: Anobha Gurung  I didn't interact with Anobha individually enough during the course of this semester but I found her really friendly and insightful. Good comments during our discussions.
Instructor: Anobha Gurung  Very helpful, warm, knowledgeable and enthusiastic
Instructor: Anobha Gurung  Strengths: Relatable, accessible Weakness: Only due to how new the course was
Instructor: Anobha Gurung  Anobha is a native of Nepal and was able to contribute personal insights which made for interesting class discussions.

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-14, if you wish
comments: This was a half-semester flipped course, which meant that there were only 6 one-hour in person class discussions. The course material is so interesting and provocative, however, that I would have preferred more in class discussion time.

The class structure is still in needs of being fully developed. I feel the flipped model works well for this class, but sometimes are discussions veer off-topic. Furthermore, maybe two hours of discussion sections and more credit would be a better way to get this class to be truly engaging. One hour isn't enough time to provide the deep insights that are necessary.
Unique class that captured a holistic and fascinating perspective of the the Himalayan region. An enriching experience. Highly recommended.

narratives.question_text: What were the best aspects of this course?
comments: Very interesting material Alark Saxena is an excellent discussion leader
Great discussion group! The discussion threads were also really engaging and interesting.
Loved the discussions. Very colorful, open-minded, intelligent and engaging. Really enjoyed the diversity of the class.
The other students were able to contribute to the discussions. Almost all the countries in the Himalayan belt were represented in the class and everyone was eager to have their opinions heard.

narratives.question_text: What aspects of this course need the most improvement?
comments: I think the course would be better in a traditional un-flipped format

The required reading was quite long and I could not get through them all. I love having many resources and enjoyed picking and choosing from the optional readings. I'd keep the required readings smaller, and put the rest in optional.
Discussion sessions could be longer. The Canvas forum was also a bit confusing especially with regard to posting in the discussion threads.

narratives.question_text: Was the relationship between the course lectures and discussion/lab section
comments: The weekly discussions related directly to the readings - this was very good
I found Alark's method of highlighting certain comments and asking the students to expand on them, to be very effective. His facilitation kept the the discussion interesting and dynamic.

narratives.question_text: Discuss, if you wish, how this course fits into your overall program.  (Please feel free to describe how the course relates to your academic background.)
comments: Nothing toshow..

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: The Himalayan region interests me

To get perspective on this region from people who have studied it extensively or have worked/lived/were born there. I did it for both personal and professional reasons. And found it to be a very satisfying and memorable course.
I'm originally from Pakistan and was interested in learning about the environmental and social issues in the region from an international perspective.

narratives.question_text: Did the knowledge/skills that you gained from the course meet your expectations ?
comments: Yes
Yes
Yes. I was expecting more focus on politics and religion but we didn't get into the depth of those topics.

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
comments: Nothing toshow..

narratives.question_text: For students who might consider taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: Take the course - the material is fascinating, and the instructor is very good at provoking thought about the issues

If you have a personal or professional interest in this region, I'd highly recommend it. It will put you in contact with like-minded people who offer diverse perspectives. The content is wonderful, but the people really make the course truly special.
